page.title: 17Glentauchers _ Mulben
page.content: Glentauchers Distillery lies about three miles from Keith on the road to Mulben. It was built in 1897, close to the Railway Line between Aberdeen and Inverness, and close also to a plentiful supply of water suitable for the production of whiskey. The water comes from springs in the nearby hills and is collected in dams south of the road to Keith. Malting began in May 1898. Brewing began in the following month. Glentauchers Distillery was closed during the Second World War years due to restrictions on the supply of barley. It re_opened in 1946. Last year, because of the recession in the Whisky Market, Glentauchers was again closed, or rather, mothballed, until demand for whisky increases again.
